data.title: taste of da islands...
data.text: ..ate here about 3pm on a Thursday...a few peeps at the bar/Happy Hour & a couple tables full...hubby had loco coco & said it was good...I had teri chicken plate...delicious...comes with the mac salad & sticky rice. Island decor/feel...they said there's HI music on the wkends.

data.title: Great food
data.text: This was my first time eating Hawaiian food and I loved it, it was super tasty, the vibe was chilled, people seemed cool and the service was good, I will definitely be going back.

data.title: Best place for poke and kalua pork!
data.text: I fell in love with this spot because I'm a big fan of Hawaii. The ambiance is so chill and has an island vibe to it. The food is delicious, I like how you can add kalua pork to your poke bowl. They have so many types of poke, we went with the combination one. On Mondays they have happy hour and we got a really strong Mai Tai for only $5! Definitely a must visit.

data.title: Fresh Food with a Fun Atmosphere
data.text:
Stopped into Pono to grab a bite and brew after hitting the surf. Definitely glad I did!

Looking around at what others were eating, the food looked really fresh and well prepared. Lots of good fun Hawaiian choices on the menu for sure. A little something for all. I ordered the poke wrap and it tasted fresh and was yummy. 

They have a decent beer selection and good drink deals at happy hour. There was a guy playing live music when I was there so that was a bonus. My only minor knock on the place is the ordering process. You stand in line to order food and a separate line at the bar (if it's busy) so that is a little annoying. 

The food and fun atmosphere definitely make it worth checking out! I will visit again if I return to Santa Cruz. Mahalo.

data.title: Cute place with a nice patio
data.text: I was wavering on the rating & chose very good because of the overall experience. Went here for lunch on a Saturday with family including small children; we sat outside because the weather was optimal. The employees were friendly and the food was tasty although I was disappointed that the ginger chilli shoyu poke bowl wasn't spicy, it was still good.The drinks were delicious but pretty weak. It seemed like the kind of place that would be busier as the day goes on, with the live band and bar.

data.title: I've eaten here twice now... enjoyed both times!
data.text:
The staff has been friendly and helpful. The atmosphere is nice. The food is really really good!
I was surprised that my kid has never been here until I suggested it last week! Now they know!

data.title: A taste of Hawaii in Santa Cruz
data.text: I'm a creature of habit when it comes to Pono. I get the tomato and avocado ahi poke pretty much every time I come here. Oh, that and a side of fries! I love coming here for groups because you order and pay BEFORE you sit down. Which means that you are only paying for what you ordered and not trying to deal with splitting the check. Their cocktails are good (although you have to go to the bar area to order drinks, can't order from the food window). Lines can get LONG and they aren't the fastest, but if you have time to chill for a bit, this is a nice place. Oh, and they have a nice outdoor patio that is dog friendly, so nice little bonus there.

data.title: Dinner on a Monday night
data.text: We were craving Hawaiian food and found this gem on Yelp. Pros: live music (amateur), indoor seating, and outdoor seating (with Hawaiian feel/foliage). The fam ordered Kalbi ribs (good!) and I ordered kuhuku shrimp (kinda bland). Overall the service was friendly and ambiance great.   It's about 6 minutes from the boardwalk if you have a car, and street parking was plentiful. There was a lot of people eating there, so I assume it's probably a local favorite.

data.title: Fresh Yummy AWESOME
data.text: Fresh Yummy AWESOME!!! staff is so nice and helpful. Don't just walk by it is so worth the stop. Cute sitting area in back. Great drinks.

data.title: Island Food!!
data.text: Great tasting food! six of us for lunch and all were highly satisfied with the service, great food and atmosphere.  I had the Kahlua Pork plate lunch and loved it. also the prices for the area are very reasonable.  Highly recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Best Loco Moco!!!
data.text:
Pono had the best loco moco we've had in CA! Juicy beef patties, eggs cooked well, better than average mac salad.  Poke wrap would've been better if the flour tortilla wasn't so thick (I ended up peeling it off) & if they didn't include the sliced ginger typically used to garnish a sushi plate.  That should be optional. Drinks are purchased separately directly from the bar.  Outside seating available in the back.  
Pro Tip: Enjoy made from scratch Penny Ice Cream for dessert just a couple blocks away.  They only make small batches of atypical flavors.

data.title: Tastes of the island in SC!!!
data.text:
Having just returned from Hawaii I was excited to find this place on Yelp, so we decided to give it a try.
Upon getting their we were blown away by the many choices of poke dishes they offered.
After ordering, we had to try a couple of Mai tais, and those did not disappoint.
We took a seat outside in the back and waited for our food to arrive.
I got the spicy poke bowl and my wife got more of a standard version.
Both were really tasty and good portion sizes
The poke was very fresh and flavorful

data.title: Traditional Hawaiian plate lunches
data.text: This was my third time to Pono Hawaiian Grill and I haven't yet been disappointed.  This place has truly authentic Hawaiian plate lunches.  I had amazing kalua pork and my wife had very good coconut shrimp.  Their pineapple cole slaw is delicious and the macaroni salad is awesome. Even the sticky white rice is perfect.

data.title: Wow
data.text: Seriously this place is awesome. Had a pono avocado and it was awesome. If you like raw fish food a la sushi, stop searching and go ahead. Will be there again and again and again. Fresh food, good veggies, good drinks. Wow.

data.title: Good food, reasonably priced.
data.text:
We had the Kalua Pork Fries which were tasty and with the addition of some rice and a macaroni salad it was a good meal my teenager really enjoyed it.  I also ordered the Shoyu Chicken Manapua (like a doughy bun with a small amount of filling) which was a bit bland but okay.
We were there for the Memorial Weekend and watched a basketball game which was entertaining for a couple of kiwi's as there were a lot San Francisco Warrior supporters very vocal and excited to see their team win!
Table could have been cleaner but they were busy, we joined a queue at the door to order our meals.  
Staff were busy, food came out quite quickly.
I would return for sure.

data.title: Wow amazing place to get a bite in SC
data.text: I recently tried this place and is by far my favorite place in SC to eat. Super healthy food, great ambiance and staff is very friendly.

data.title: Really Dogs have a menu?
data.text:
Really Dogs have a menu? News to me. They gave my dog a bowl of water but NO Dog menu was offered. Bummer for them...
Also Don't answer the phone and take "Take out orders: While folks are waiting in line to eat.
We tip! Take out order folks don't....Duh!

data.title: Aloha !
data.text: I love Hawaii and has been there many times so I was very happy to find this hidden gem in Santa Cruz this week when we came to visit UC Santa Cruz! I love the ambience of this place! The poke bowl was also very delicious!

data.title: Stopover in Santa Cruz... Hawaiian ...!?
data.text: Part of the menu is but lots of Asian influence more to Korean dishes. Lovely place very familial and the live band is playing on stage. Heated seating area at the back.

data.title: Pono is ono!
data.text: In Hawaiian, "ono" means "delicious", and "pono" means "righteousness".  Pono specializes in delicious Hawaiian dishes, done just right. They have an entire menu category devoted to poke (pronounced "po-kay")., which is basically chunks of raw ahi tuna with spicy sauce.  My favorite is the wasabe poke tower, which has great fresh ahi, avocado, and chips all piled up.  Just the snack to enjoy with a Longboard draft beer or Hawaiian mai tai from their full bar.  They always have a line out the door at lunch and happy hour.  In summer, you can sit out on the back patio.  They also feature live music several nights a week.  Pono is da kine grinds!
